NEW PROGRAM DRAWS PARALLEL’S IN NAEB'S “WORLD RENEWAL"
The Yurok Indians, living a rich life in the small villages along the
banks of the Klamath River of Northern California, believed that sins formed
a cloud of pestilence and that they must perform a ten-day dance or World
Renewal ceremony to drive back this miasma of sin.
A story of how these early people sought within the beliefs and
framework of their stone-age culture to drive back evil and keep from
constant open tribe-warfare is unfolded in “ World Renewal", a new half
hour broadcast presented as an adult education project by the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters,
“World Renewal", written by Charles Israel and produced by
Andrew Allan, is part of the NAEB second series on "The Ways of Mankind",
The program, which also is the last of four presentations devoted to a
study of Yurok culture, will be heard at (time) -- on -- (date) -- over
radio station -- (name).
Dr. Walter Goldschmidt, anthropologist of the University of
California, served as project director for the entire "Ways of Mabkind"
series, and Alfred L, Kroeber, Professor Emeritus of Anthropology of
the University of California, was special consultant for the four programs
on the Yurok.
As we learn in this final Yurok program, these early Indians were
a proud people, tense andrestrained. They were anxious to be well
thought of. But pride can lead to suspicion and this in turn to quarrels.
The Yurok took no insult lightly, were not a peaceful people. Nor could
they live up to the strict rules of conduct their culture demanded. Sins
were committed.
So all was tense during the ceremonies of World Renewal, as radio
listeners will learn from this description of one. All was tense in the
remembrance of hatreds and sins that made the ceremony necessary, tense
in the rivalry that existed in the display of wealth by the rich, tense in the
fear that some fresh outbreak might prevent the purpose of the dance.
To the radio listener will be pointed out that perhaps these early
people, primitive though they were, had a glimpse of the truth. For preservfcig
the ritual meant successful cooperation and the resolution of conflicts. This
indeed might be an eternal secret, for all time and ages, of World Renewal.
